column2: Oh, hey! My name's Faber, I run the Maker Space here at the Conservatory. Want to try solving a puzzle?

Good to meet you!  You must be the Fizzics whiz Riley told me about. I almost didn't hear you come in! 

Just here jamming out & making some solar pizza. Alright, so let's get this puzzle running for you. 

See if you can find a way to solve this. Go ahead and launch Fizzics.
Here's your challenge: Make it so all 10 of these green balls are touching the red spiky ball at the same time.
Clearly you'll need to hack into Fizzics to do this.
Try adjusting the settings for attraction and repulsion.
What if you make the green balls smaller?
That's what I'm talking about! Way to go! Riley certainly was right about you.
Hey Faber, since we're here, do you have any clue what this weird rusty thingamajig might be?

Hmmm, let me see. Let me immerse it in this clarifying solution. 

Whoa, look at that! This stuff really works! Hold up! Riley, I think this is part of a Stealth Device! 

I can't believe you found this! This is so major. Totally cool to actually hold one in my hands!
What exactly is a Steath Device, Faber?

A Stealth Device lets you go anywhere undetected. Not that you'd ever want something like that, Riley! 

I once glimpsed some schematics of a device like this. 

Rumors have it that the legendary hacker Leviathan used a device like this one in his exploits.

Let me get this right. A device that lets us go anywhere undetected? Fascinating. Fascinating. 

We just might have a use for that! Purely for research purposes of course. ʌ˽ʌ Thanks Faber! You rule.
